intro: Penaea sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Penaea sulcata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
